fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When using the quick search to search for strings containing only numbers, instead of performing the search, JIRA will try to access an issue using the number string as the issue number. As an example, if you try to search for "12345", JIRA will try to access issue ABC-12345. However, if you search for "A12345", you will be taken to the issue navigator with an applied filter searching for the "A12345" string.

h3. Suggested Solution

Make the quick search work with number strings just as it does with strings that contain letters.

h3. Workaround 

The only workaround for this is to access the issue navigator directly and perform the search using the *Text* master-field.
fields.summary: Improve the usability of the quick search with number only strings

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The documentation about events within JIRA does not make it very clear when JIRA System Events will be fired vs workflow events.  Specifically, Issue Updated and Issue Assigned are not fired when a workflow is making those changes:
[Adding a custom event - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/adding-a-custom-event-861253643.html]

h3. Suggested Solution

Based on my testing locally with the DebugListener it appears that:
* The JIRA built-in system events (full list [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/adding-a-custom-event-861253643.html]) are only fired if the action is not performed by a workflow transition.
* *Issue updated* takes precedent over the other events in the case of editing an issue or automation based changes.
* *Issue assigned* is only fired if the *assign* button is clicked or keyboard shortcut is used, not if the assignee is altered in workflow transitions, edits, or ticket creation
* *Issue commented* is fired only when a comment is made outside of a workflow transition or other change
* *Issue resolved* appears to be an outlier here and does get called regardless of what action triggered the resolution to be set

So the basic rule of thumb seems to be that if more than one action is performed, then the event that encompasses the entire action is used, with *Issue resolved* being the exception.  With Service Desk Automation or other 3rd party automation/scripting solutions you may see more events generated.
 
h3. Workaround
 Use the DebugListerner to test your workflow and determine which events are firing:
* [Listeners - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/listeners-867028226.html]
fields.summary: Document JIRA System Event triggers clearly

fields.description:
Many questions I receive from our users are regarding the calculation of completed points within the Velocity Chart.  Most users don't understand that completed points include any resolution or status mapped to the last column of the board.

I propose adding an optional breakdown of Completed story points by Status/Resolution within the Velocity Chart to make the chart more meaningful.
fields.summary: Include a breakdown of completed points by resolution within the Velocity Chart

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Using Rich Text Editor when inline editing eg. description field on view issue switching from visual tab to text tab causes content to be saved and exit from edit mode.

h3. Environment
IE11
Edge15
h3. Steps to Reproduce
* create issue
* go to view issue
* click description to inline edit it
* switch to visual tab
* enter some content
* click "text tab"

h3. Expected Results
Content is displayed as text


h3. Actual Results
Content is saved and RTE exits edit mode
 
h3. Notes
none

h3.Workaround
- start editing again
- refresh page
- use different browser
fields.summary: Switching from visual to text mode in RTE causes content save/exit edit mode on IE and Edge

fields.description:
h3. Symptoms

When user is managing issues with sub-task. Hovering mouse over selected sub-task does not show buttons to change order of sub-tasks.  !image-2017-06-30-12-06-16-152.png|width=630,height=85!
h3. Expected behaviour 

Buttons to reorder sub-task are visible.

!image-2017-06-30-12-09-15-401.png|width=631,height=88!
h3. Workaround

Enable drag and drop subtasks feature. {color:#FF0000}WARNING{color}: This feature is in development and may sometimes behave unstable. It will not break your data, but UI may not show exact results of the operation, refreshing the page will fix the glitch.
 # As a JIRA administrator, navigate to _<JIRA-URL>/secure/SiteDarkFeatures!default.jspa_
 # Add the following dark feature flag: {{com.atlassian.jira.issuetable.draggable}}

You may also want to also add {{com.atlassian.jira.issuetable.move.links.hidden}} feature flag to hide in UI the place for reorder buttons.
fields.summary: Reorder sub-tasks buttons are missing

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Raise an issue.
 # Add 2 or more subbtasks to the issue.
 # Attempt to re-order sub-tasks

 
h3. Expected results

Sub tasks can be re-ordered.

 
h3. Actual results

No visual controls are available to change the order of the sub-tasks.
fields.summary: Re-order subtasks buttons are missing in issue details

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, JIRA only allows Administrators to add groups to specific Application Access. User would like the ability to add entire User Directory so they can add all the users in a specific directory to an Application Access.


h3. Suggested Solution

Add option to add specific User Directory to an Application Access.


h3. Workaround 

Add each group from User Directory to the Application Access.
fields.summary: Add ability to add specific directory to Application Access

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The [JIRA Agile - JIRA Configuration|https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile/jira-agile-administrator-s-guide/jira-agile-jira-configuration] is available for JIRA Agile but after the introduction of JIRA Software, the same information shown in this documentation is not added to any JIRA Software related documentation. 

Customer looking for database & JIRA Software specific customfield will have to refer to the JIRA Agile documentation instead of JIRA Software documentation.


h3. Suggested Solution

Add a new documentation for JIRA Software with the same information available in [JIRA Agile - JIRA Configuration|https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile/jira-agile-administrator-s-guide/jira-agile-jira-configuration].
fields.summary: Additional documentation for JIRA Software

fields.description:
h3. Problem 
Active nodes in the Jira DC cluster query the data for the offline nodes which might be long gone. That adds overhead to DB. 
The problem should be largely mitigated by a fix in JRASERVER-42916

h3. Steps to reproduce:
* Set up two node JDC instance (jdc-node-1 / jdc-node-2)
* Enable SQL logging on node one 
* Node 1: {{tail -f atlassian-jira-sql.log | grep jdc-node-2}}
** Observe the SQL queries repeating
* Perform normal shutdown of jdc-node-2 (stop-jira.sh)
** Observe the SQL queries continue forever

h3. Experienced Behavior
* Active nodes query for offline node messages and index operations

h3. Expected Behavior
* Active nodes do not query for messages and index operations for nodes known to be offline.

h3. Note:
* Node 1 shows node 2 as being offline in System Information and in database clusternode table.
* Removing node 2 row from clusternode immediately stops these queries. They start up immediately when the row is added back.

h5. Example SQL Logging
* {{tail -f atlassian-jira-sql.log | grep jdc-node-2}}

With the new interface, there is no way to change the version of the documentation we are looking at (except using the search functionality, of course).

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Health-check index consistency check needs to be relaxed for JIRA Server (separate from DC issue JRASERVER-61501). 

h3. Environment
JIRA Server

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Run heath-check

h3. Expected Results
Heath-check doesn't show error

h3. Actual Results
For JIRA it will be false positive and give following alerts:
* The issue index is inconsistent with the database state. The last issue update recorded in the database was at (Date) but the last issue update recorded in the index was at (Same Date)
fields.summary: Reduce strictness of Index Consistency health check in Jira

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unable to apply new license during upgrade to 7.4.0
h3. Environment
 * Fresh installation of JIRA 7.4.0
 * In setup wizard, selected an XML backup zip from a previous version of JIRA (7.3.3)
 * Did not enter in a new license key in the first dialog box

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install JIRA 7.4.0 via tar.gz install packate
 # Start JIRA
 # select an XML backup from previous JIRA version to restore to this new install
 # Do not enter a license key in the first page
 # JIRA does then warn you that this install needs a new license key

h3. Expected Results
 # JIRA's "Confirm New Installation" page allows you to enter a new license key here

h3. Actual Results

JIRA does not allow you to enter a new license key here. There is a dialog box for options of
{quote}I have a key

Proceed under the Evaluation Terms
{quote}
But selecting either of these do not have any kind of "Next" button, or any other dialog box to continue the process to then add a new license key eval or otherwise

!licenseerror1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

Restarting JIRA does not resolve this issue, you are still taken to this same page.
h3. Workarounds
 # Apply an updated license key to the JIRA instance before generating the XML backup
 # Apply the updated license key in the first dialog box that appears on the same page as when you select the filename to restore the XML backup
fields.summary: Unable to apply new license during upgrade to 7.4.0

fields.description:
As stated in the "Applicable" section from our [Creating a JIRA report|https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/jira-platform/guides/projects/tutorial-creating-a-jira-report] page, this tutorial applies only from JIRA 5.0 to 7.1.

Please upgrade the documentation confirming if the steps still apply for the latest JIRA version, or including the correct steps for the latest version if they don't apply anymore. Thanks!
fields.summary: Update our "Creating a JIRA report" documentation

fields.description:
In a JIRA ticket, when you open the pull requests window from the Development panel , it only has the ID and Title of the pull request (along with the status, author, reviewer and updated date). It would be nice if it has a column which lists the Destination branch of each pull requests.

Currently to determine the destination branch of each PR, the user will either have to remember each of the pull requests name -- or click and open all URLs of the pull requests to determine the destination branch for them.
fields.summary: Development panel should show the destination branch of a Pull Request

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently JIRA uses bundled open source jTDS JDBC drivers for connecting to Microsoft SQL server which doesn't support working with Extended protection enabled by SQL Server.
SQL Server supports Extended Protection beginning with SQL Server 2008 R2.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Provide an alternative recommendation for customers who use Extended protection and a way to configure JIRA on working with it enabled.

h3. Why this is important
* Many IT security teams would enable this feature in the future and JIRA should have a way in working with it smoothly.
fields.summary: JIRA need to support SQL server Extended protection mode

fields.description:
h3. Problem

The warning will come up and once you go to the UI (seconds later) and look at the health checks, the check is passing. This is causing some false alerts and admins have decided to just turn off this check. For example: JRASERVER-61501

Looking at the code, it looks like the check is triggered when the latest issue in the database does not correlate with JQL {{order by updatedDate desc}} after a second of difference. In this case, the check fails for a few seconds and then passes, causing the admins to lose confidence in the tool.
h3. Suggestion

Allow user to configure the time when this alert is triggered (e.g. 1 min instead of 1 sec)
fields.summary: Improvement on health check lucene index

h3. Summary
When an AD user who is expired, reactivated again, this user will lose all local group membership in JIRA

h3. Environment
# JIRA
# Microsoft Active Directory. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Connect JIRA to AD using Read Only, with Local Groups with the "Filter out expired users" enabled
# Create a user in AD 
# Add this user as a member of a local JIRA group ( On JIRA )
# Go back to the AD and set the user to expire today.
# Sync the directory in JIRA and notice that the user will go missing ( This user does not have any issue history )
# Go back to the AD and set the user to Account Expires = "Never"
# Sync the directory in JIRA and notice that 

h3. Expected Results
The user should appear again with the previous group membership

h3. Actual Results
The user appears again but without any groups membership

fields.description:
Hi JIRA friends,

we are using JIRA 7.1.9 and right now I am not able to add *Issue Security Level* to *Group Custom Field Value* in a permission scheme.

It is possible to assign a ticket to User A, even a security level B is set in the issue and User A isn't part of security level B.

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38134

The reason of this suggestion is that we would like to limit assignable users only to users being part of a security level.

I tried the permission helper and it tells me that User A won't be assignable for my issue.

!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

Sadly I was still able to assign the issue to User A!

 

Can you please improve project permission to grant permission only to users being part of a security level?

 

Can you provide us workarounds meanwhile?

 

Thank you and best wishes

Christopher

fields.description:
h3. Preconditions

* Link JIRA 7.3.x with Confluence 5.9.x or higher.
* Ensure that JIRA is talking with Confluence via REST.
** This is the default behaviour in JIRA 7.3.x, but can be toggled by dark feature.
** Go to {{/secure/admin/SiteDarkFeatures!default.jspa}}, and check that "{{confluence.issuelinks.use.rest.api.disabled}}" *is not present*.
* Ensure there are two user accounts can log in to both JIRA and Confluence.
** I'll call them "bob" and "alice".
* Create a project in JIRA whose issues can be browsed by anonymous users.
* Create a space in Confluence whose pages can only be seen by authenticated users.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# As Bob, in Confluence,
## Create a page that is accessible by any logged-in user. Call it something like "Logged-in test".
## Create a page that only bob can access. Call it "Page by Bob".
# As Bob, in JIRA,
## Create a new issue in the public project.
## Link to both the "Logged-in test" page and the "Page by Bob" page.
# Log out of JIRA.
# View the issue as an anonymous user.

h3. Expected results

...

h3. Actual results

* In the UI, the anonymous user sees a "Page failed to load" message for the Confluence page link with a spinner that spins forever.
* In the JIRA log files, the following message will appear: {noformat}Error occurred while generating final HTML for remote issue link: java.lang.RuntimeException: java.io.IOException: Failed to load Confluence Page from remote server Caused by: java.io.IOException: Failed to load Confluence Page from remote server Caused by: com.atlassian.sal.api.net.ResponseException: Status Code: 404, Status Text: Not Found, Errors: {}, Error Messages: [The requested Confluence content could not be found.]{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Enable the "{{confluence.issuelinks.use.rest.api.disabled}}" dark feature for the JIRA instance. This will cause JIRA to use XMLRPC to communicate with Confluence. Confluence's XMLRPC responses do not return 404 responses for unauthorized requests, so the errors aren't raised on the JIRA side.
fields.summary: Valid Confluence page links cause error logs when anonymous users access the page

fields.description:
As an Administrator I would like to be able to disable public access to JIRA, so the users will have to login before they can browse projects, search issues or navigate to system dashboard.

*Workaround:*
In JIRA 7.2.10 the possibility to disable public access for anonymous users was added, however it is still in labs state.

In order to disable public access for anonymous users, administrator needs to add a darkfeature public.access.disabled. 
Here are the steps required for adding a dark feature in Jira:
* Login as an administrator and go to: [BASE-URL]/secure/SiteDarkFeatures!default.jspa
* In the Enable Dark Feature text field add *public.access.disabled*
fields.summary: Add possibility to disable public access to JIRA

fields.description:
This is a feedback issue as redirected from the EAP page for JIRA 7.4.

Kanban boards now let you manage epics among the other issues right in the backlog list. This is great.

However, you cannot simply drag issues onto an epic like you can for the old Kanban board (or the Scrum board) where the epics are managed on the epic panel.

 

Since managing epics requires a lot of issue-assignment, drag&drop should be supported for epics in the backlog list, as well.
fields.summary: Feedback 7.4 EAP: Kanban Boards Should Support Dragging Issues onto Epics in the Backlog

fields.description:
h6. Problem

As owner of a Dashboard, if I accidentally click on anything in the 'sort by' row, that sort by will supersede the ORDER BY in JQL and the whole team will have the incorrect order.
!screenshot-gadgetsort.png|thumbnail!

h6. Steps to reproduce
* Create a Dashboard and share it with your team.
* Create a saved filter that includes an ORDER BY clause and share it with your team.
* Add a Filter Results gadget using the new fillter.
* Click on the top of one of the field columns.

h6. Result
* All users will see the Filter Results gadget sorted by the column you clicked, not the ORDER BY clause of the JQL.

h6. Expected
* One user clicking the column header would not change the sorting for everyone else.

h6. Workaround
* The owner has to delete the Filter Results gadget and re-add it to the dashboard.

h6. Suggested Fixes
 * Add a reset button to the Filter Resutls gadget to restore sorting to the JQL ORDER BY clause.
 * Don't let the dashboard owner's "click to sort" actions change the sorting for other users.
fields.summary: Dashboard owner's click-to-sort for Filter Results gadget persists for all users

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At this time, JIRA is unable to authenticate using xoauth2 even if the argument is set on the JVM via {{-Dmail.imaps.auth.xoauth2.disable=false}}. This makes using the *Secure Apps* option in GMail not possible with JIRA, forcing customers to use the *Less Secure Apps* option.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add *xoauth2* support to JIRA.

h3. Workaround 
At this time, the only workaround is to allow the connection through *Less Secure Apps* to GMail accounts.
fields.summary: Add xoauth2 support to JIRA

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA Service Desk and enable Excel export by following the instructions in [this KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-excel-export-of-issues-no-longer-opens-correctly-838403242.html].

# In the issue navigator, add "Customer Request Type" to display column.
# Select the issues from the sample project.
# Verify that the icon of "Customer Request Type" is correctly displayed in JIRA.
# Export issues in Excel.
# Open the export file with MS Excel.

h3. Expected Results
icons of "Customer Request Type" are displayed correctly in the Excel file.

h3. Actual Results
icons of "Customer Request Type" are broken.
 
h3. Notes
Same issue for the HTML Export in JIRA 7.4.0 (EAP-20170613112820) which is currently unreleased.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When we try to link issues to an issue via the More > Link window, if one of the linked issues does not exist, the whole issue list will be cleared if we click on the "link" button.
h3. Environment
 * JIRA 7.3.6
 * Chrome Version 55.0.2883.95 (64-bit)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open an issue in the Issue View screen
 # Click on "More" then select "Link"
 # From the "Link" pop-up window, add a list of issue keys that exist and an issue key that doesn't exist to the "Issue" field (in the screenshot below, the issue key SP-30 does not exist):
 !BeforeClickingOnLinkButton.png|thumbnail!
 # Click on the "Link" button

h3. Expected Results
 - The error "The issue key "SP-30" does not exist" is displayed
 - The invalid issue key is cleared from the Issue field, but the other issue keys are not cleared from the field

h3. Actual Results

The error "The issue key "SP-30" does not exist" is displayed, which is expected, but all the other issue keys (that exist) are cleared from the Issue field, as shown in the screenshot below, and the user has to re-enter all the valid issue keys:
 !AfterClickingOnLinkButton.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes

The expected results are based on how the linking works from the Issue Edit screen.
When we try to link issues from the Issue Edit screen, even if an issue that doesn't exist is added, the full list is not cleared after the user click on the "Update" button, as shown in the screenshot below:
!EditScreen_AfterClickingUpdateButton.png|thumbnail!

For consistency, the "More > Link" screen should behave the same way.

h3. Workaround

Instead of using the "More > Link" screen, open the Issue Edit screen and link issues from this screen.
fields.summary: When linking issues, the list of issues gets cleared if one issue does not exist

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Using the original "Export to Excel" functionality, ticket assignee/reporters were exported using the display name (e.g., *Jane Doe*) rather than the username (e.g., *jdoe823*). Now when exporting to CSV, these fields are coming across as username.
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide an option to allow users (or administrators) to choose whether they'd like the export file to user display name or username. If this proves not to be feasible as it might break compatibility of the exported CSV data with CSV import,  then as an alternative approach provide an option to export display name *as well as* username.
h3. Why this is important

Many organizations have established reporting built around the data originally included within Excel exports. Allowing users to choose how assignees/reporters are displayed will allow them to use existing workflows without modification.
fields.summary: As a user, I want more control over how CSV export displays assignee/reporter names

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-68220].
  {panel}

When sorting results of issues by clicking on column header of any text field , the resulting sort order is technically correct but counterintuitive for users with languages that have certain special characters included in its alphabet:
 The sorting is currently as follows:
 First the text with upper case first letter (A-Z) occur
 then the text with lower case first letter (a-z) occur
 then the text with special characters, sorted on similar manner (upper case first, lower case after).

Examples for this are Polish, German and Spanish.

The suggestion is that these special characters should be sorted according to the alphabet of the language currently in use.
 * An specific example in Spanish: the six characters with diacritics Á, É, Í, Ó, Ú, Ü are treated as the original letters A, E, I, O, U, therefore when sorting, it should be A, Á...E, É...I, Í...O, Ó.
 * See [Wikipedia: Alphabetical order of different languages|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alphabetical_order]
 * [Polish alphabet|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polish_alphabet].
fields.summary: Change the sorting of special characters in the issue navigator according to the language currently in use

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a user has a JIRA issue open in the browser, and they are idle long enough for their user session to expire, they will see an indefinite browser hang when attempting to comment on the issue.

h3. Environment
Tested against JIRA 7.2.8 and JIRA 7.2.9 using current versions of Chrome, Firefox, Safari, IE and Edge on Windows, Linux and Mac. Behavior occurs in all contexts.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- [Change the default session timeout|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira063/changing-the-default-session-timeout-683542392.html] to 5 minutes and restart JIRA.
- Authenticate to a user and navigate to an issue.
- Allow 5 minutes to elapse and the user session to timeout.
- Click the *Comment* button.

h3. Observed Results
One of two behaviors will happen, and it is hit-or-miss as to which will be observed:
# The user will experience a spinning cursor which will never resolve; an indefinite hang. The user will need to reload the page and reauthenticate to add a comment.
# The user will be able to enter a comment, but upon clicking the *Add* button they will experience the spinning cursor and indefinite hang. The user will need to reload the page and reauthenticate to be able to add a comment.

Again, this is hit-or-miss. The latter behavior appears more often in IE/Edge in my testing.

h3. Expected Results
Instead of experiencing the hang, users should be prompted to authenticate before commenting. With the present behavior it looks like JIRA has become unresponsive to the user.

h3. Workaround
Refresh any idle issue page before adding a comment.
fields.summary: Attempting to add a comment to an issue hangs if user session is expired

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

As an admin user, when JIRA is crash unexpectedly, we couldn't find any indication of why its crash from the logs (eg. catalina.out or atlassian-jira.log).

Basically, when JIRA is down, we will see the following stack trace:
{code:java}
2017-06-21 18:30:51,640 localhost-startStop-2 INFO      [c.a.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher] Stopping launchers
2017-06-21 18:30:51,785 localhost-startStop-2 INFO      [c.a.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager] Preparing to shut down the plugin system
{code}
The stack trace above only shown when JIRA is shutdown by using the service script or in any other graceful way not crash.
h3. Suggested Solution

If possible, if JIRA are crash when not returning any stack trace in the logs, it would create a helpful log that would indicate of why JIRA crash.
h3. Alternative KB articles to determine if JIRA is running or crash
 * [How to check the JIRA application is running|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-check-the-jira-application-is-running-794499415.html]
 * [How to Resolve JIRA Process being Terminated Unexpectedly in Linux|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-resolve-jira-process-being-terminated-unexpectedly-in-linux-298978808.html]
fields.summary: More helpful log of telling why JIRA is Crash

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30371].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 11 January 2017|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

CORS has been supported in the JIRA REST API since JIRA 6.0 for JIRA Server. If you are a JIRA Server customer, simply go to the "Whitelist" section of JIRA Administration and add the domains you wish to request resources from. *Note:* You must have the System Administrator global permission to access this section of JIRA administration.

Unfortunately, this domain whitelist is not available in JIRA Cloud for security reasons. We haven't yet been able to spend time developing a pattern for supporting this in JIRA Cloud, but we do intend to work on this at some point in the future.

I have updated the issue summary to more accurately reflect the current status of this feature.

Regards,

Dave Meyer
 [dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
 Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}
JIRA REST API documentation ([http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#authentication]) says: ... if you are using JIRA in a browser you can call REST from Javascript on the page and rely on the authentication that the browser has established.

However it does not work, see my example [http://jsfiddle.net/avalez/nCcq9/2/] and others complains: [https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/69356/cross-origin-resource-sharing-with-jira-rest-api-and-javascript]

Looks like Access-Control-Allow-Origin response header is missing.

CAUTION, to make it really work for remote clients, it's necessary to respond with exact match for host name in Access-Control-Allow-Origin header, see related AMKT-3342 ([https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/AMKT-3342]).
fields.summary: Allow cross-domain requests for CORS

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using the CSV importer, the resolution is not correctly set on the issues being imported, incorrectly setting it to *Unresolved*.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a CSV with just the Description, Summary, and Resolution Fields.
# Import the CSV from External System Import.

h3. Expected Results

The Resolution will be set to the value from the CSV file.

h3. Actual Results

The Resolution is set to *Unresolved*.
 
h3.Workaround

Add the Status column to your CSV, and import again.
fields.summary: CSV Importer Does Not Set Resolution Unless Status Is Set

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Additional unwanted data is currently being exported to CSV that wasn't previously included when exporting to Excel. As a user, I'd like to have more granular control over exactly what columns are included in the export. 
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a dialogue and allow users to choose which fields they'd like to include in the exported data. For example, users may choose to omit Issue Id or Component information.
h3. Why this is important

Many organizations have established reporting built around the data originally included within Excel exports. Allowing users to choose what columns to include in the CSV will allow them to use existing workflows without modification.
fields.summary: As a user, I want more granular control of the data exported to CSV

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Version Report gadget is not loading when there are about 20000 issues in the backlog and 4000 issues in the specific fix version.
h3. Steps to Replicate
 # Create a Board filter that will result to approximately 20K issues.
 # Create a Version and have about 4K issues on this version.
 # Add the Version Report gadget on the dashboard and select the board filter in Step 1 and Version in Step 2.
 # Save and view the gadget on the dashboard.

h3. Expected Result

The gadget should be displayed and loaded properly.
h3. Actual Result

The gadget never loads and ended up with a timeout.
 !version.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Increase the timeout by adding the following line to {{<jira-home>/jira-config.properties}}:
 * {{http.connection.timeout = 15000}}
 * Restart JIRA
fields.summary: Version Report Gadget Never Loads and Ended up Timing Out

h3. Workaround

Modify the relevant {{<ChangeItem>}} entity in XML backup file by changing the value of {{newvalue}} and/or {{oldvalue}} attribute from {{[*****]}} to {{*****}} (Remove the brackets to make it a valid number).

It is also possible to fix the data at the source by deleting all the history items where the version custom field was mapped to a version that doesn't exist anymore. 
*Proceed with caution, please backup your data first, Atlassian Support is not responsible for data loss from the result of these queries*
{code}
# replace PROJ with actual project key
DELETE FROM changeitem WHERE id IN (SELECT ci.id FROM changeitem ci INNER JOIN changegroup cg ON ci.groupid=cg.id INNER JOIN jiraissue ji ON cg.issueid=ji.id INNER JOIN project ON ji.project=project.id WHERE (field LIKE '%Version%' OR field IN (SELECT cfname FROM customfield WHERE customfieldtypekey LIKE '%version%')) AND (ci.oldvalue::integer NOT IN (SELECT id::integer FROM projectversion WHERE project=project.id) OR ci.newvalue::integer NOT IN (SELECT id::integer FROM projectversion WHERE project=project.id)) AND project.pkey='PROJ');
{code}
fields.summary: ChangeItem data of Version custom field cause exception during project import

fields.description:
Currently I get an email digest including red and green lines of items that
have changed for a particular Jira ticket. 

However, when I review this in Jira - it is a mess. I cannot easily tell
what has or hasn't changed in the history.


I want to be able to review these redlines from within the Jira UI.

 

Thanks for your help.
fields.summary: Show Red highlight and Green highlight in UI same as email from JIRA.

fields.description:
Currently on the marketplace download site of [https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/update]
 Immediately after you download JIRA, there is a section that appears that contains System Requirements, Supported platforms, Scaling JIRA.

However the link on this page to system requirements is actually linking to the current confluence system reqs : [https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/server-hardware-requirements-guide-30736403.html]

Instead I think this is should currently be something more along the lines of [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/jira-applications-installation-requirements-861253014.html]

!sysreq.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/update page has Confluence system requirements link

fields.description:
h3. Definition
There are cases where the release notes have to be granted to any user who doesn't have JIRA license. 

h3. Suggestion
It would be helpful to have a permission specific to release notes/release versions.
fields.summary: Permission Specific to Release Notes

fields.description:
Once several filters have been created, you can only change their sharing permissions one-by-one. Tedious and inefficient. 

+Typical scenario+: test-driving some report/dashboard based on multiple filters, creating them as Private filters. Then , after testing and debugging, all of those filters need to be re-shared with your broad target audience (a Group or a Project or whatever combination). You have to manually go through editing each filter and assigning the required projects/groups to share with.

*EXPECTED*: allow bulk editing of sharing permissions for multiple selected filters (or for a filter search resultset).
 - Select the needed filters,
 - Click "Share selected filers with...",
 - Then goes your regular dialog for adding shared groups/projects,
 - ...and what you select there will be applied to all filters you've selected/checkmarked before.
fields.summary: Bulk edit filter sharing/permissions

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Per [Installing JIRA Data Center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Installing+JIRA+Data+Center], the following directories need to be in the JIRA shared home and are checked on startup: 
{panel}
data
plugins
logos
import
export
{panel}

However, the folder 'caches' is also a required folder for JIRA External Gadgets. 

For example, if the 'caches' folder is missing from the JIRA Shared Home, attempting to view and/or insert a JIRA gadget into Confluence will result in an error: "com.atlassian.sal.api.net.ResponseException: Can not retrieve jira chart image"

h3. Environment

* JIRA Data Center

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA Data Center following the steps in [Installing JIRA Data Center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Installing+JIRA+Data+Center].
# Create an application link between JIRA and a Confluence instance.
# Add a Gadget Feed from Confluence to the JIRA Data Center instance.
# Create a Confluence page and insert a JIRA Gadget.
# Insert the desired configuration and click Preview.

h3. Expected Results

The chart will display in the Preview window.

h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the UI:

{noformat}
com.atlassian.sal.api.net.ResponseException: Can not retrieve jira chart image
{noformat}

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
/rest/gadget/1.0/createdVsResolved/generate [
c.a.p.r.c.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: Error generating chart
java.lang.RuntimeException: Error generating chart
        at com.atlassian.jira.charts.CreatedVsResolvedChart.generateChartInternal(CreatedVsResolvedChart.java:232)
        at com.atlassian.jira.charts.CreatedVsResolvedChart.generateChart(CreatedVsResolvedChart.java:101)
        at com.atlassian.jira.charts.DefaultChartFactory.generateCreatedVsResolvedChart(DefaultChartFactory.java:61)
        at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor5978.invoke(Unknown Source)
...
Caused by: java.io.IOException: No such file or directory
        at java.io.UnixFileSystem.createFileExclusively(Native Method)
        at java.io.File.createTempFile(File.java:2024)
        at com.atlassian.jira.charts.jfreechart.ChartHelper.getChartTempFile(ChartHelper.java:205)
        at com.atlassian.jira.charts.jfreechart.ChartHelper.createChartImage(ChartHelper.java:119)
        at com.atlassian.jira.charts.jfreechart.ChartHelper.generate(ChartHelper.java:108)
        ... 265 more
{noformat}

h3.Workaround

Create a folder called 'caches' in the JIRA Shared Home directory. Ensure that directory can be read and written by other potential nodes
fields.summary: JIRA shared home 'caches' folder is not checked on startup

fields.description:
We use Confluence to track our quarterly goals and frequently link JIRA issues that coincide with quarterly goal work.  Every time we link an Issue, it causes the updated timestamp in the linked JIRA issue to progress.  

This messes up some of our reports as it looks like there's been an actual change in the JIRA issue via the report, but all that's happened is someone pasted the URL to the JIRA issue in a Confluence page.  This can mess up report filters with invalid updated timestamps.

Is there a way we could prevent a simple JIRA issue linking in a Confluence page from modifying the updated timestamp on said JIRA issue?
fields.summary: Linking a JIRA issue in a Confluence page shouldn't update a JIRA issue

fields.description:
Currently, when spinning up a new JIRA Data Center environment using the AWS Quick Start template, it updates JIRA's settings to the DNS name used by Amazon's ELB.

Since most customers will be using a custom domain, we should provision that upon setup, in order not to have to update the configuration on a per-node basis manually (by SSHing into the EC2 instances).
fields.summary: Quick Start template for JIRA Data Center on AWS should allow configuration of custom DNS name

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When creating a hyperlink using the 'External Link' in the WYSIWYG editor, the 'http://example.com' does not change when you highlight it and paste a different URL in.  Instead, a hyperlink that says 'http://example.com' is created that points to the URL you pasted in.

h3. Environment
Reproduced in 
* 7.3.6
* 7.3.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Go to any JIRA ticket
2. Click in the comment box to write a comment(select the Visual tab)
3. Click on the icon to add a link
4. Select External Link
5. The link title will appear in the comment box.
6. Highlight the text "link title" and type whatever you want... like test
7. Copy any URL to your clipboard.
8. Highlight the text "http://example.com" and press ctrl+v or right-click Paste to paste the link.
9. The text "http://example.com" will not change to the link you've tried to paste, it will stay the same, but it will turn blue, and underlined, indicating there is now a hyperlink.
10. Publish the comment and click on the link text. You should be directed to whichever page you pasted.

h3. Expected Results

In step 9, it is expected that the text of the link should change to the URL you pasted. 

h3. Actual Results

The link stays as "http://example.com"

h3.Workaround

Use the Text tab in the WYSIWYG editor
fields.summary: Copy/Paste with External Link in WYSIWYG editor doesn't change URL in Visual mode

fields.description:
h3. Summary

There are references to tomcat6w and tomcat7w in the JIRA 7.x documentations for [Increasing JIRA application memory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver074/increasing-jira-application-memory-881683971.html], which are inapplicable to JIRA 7.x because these versions are shipped with Tomcat 8 using tomcat8w.

Apart from that, the respective docs for [JIRA 7.5+|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver075/increasing-jira-application-memory-935391651.html] do not contain guidance for JIRA 7.x+ with tomcat8w. This is misleading and will surely cause confusion as JIRA 7.x customers will run tomcat7w instead, which won't work.

h3. Suggestion

Update the JIRA 7.x documentations to reflect Tomcat 8 with tomcat8w appropriately.
fields.summary: Increasing JIRA Application Memory documentation for JIRA 7 has outdated references to Tomcat 7

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Even though the TTL of OAuth access token seems to be set as 157680000000 (5 years) by default on JIRA 6.4, [this document|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira064/allowing-oauth-access-720416104.html] said it should be 7 days.

{quote}
Expires On: 
The date when the OAuth access token expires. This is seven days after the 'Issued On' date. When this date is reached, the access token will be automatically removed from this list.
{quote}

(i) As far as I checked [the document of the latest version (JIRA Software Server 7.3)|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver073/allowing-oauth-access-861256157.html], there is no statement about the information. (And the TTL seems to be set as 157680000000 in JIRA 7.3 as well.)

h3. Suggested Solution

The incorrect statement should be removed.
fields.summary: Documentation about TTL of OAuth access token

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In the Issue Navigator page, when searching for issues, NVDA Screen Reader will jump to the first issues in the result return which are expected. However, to go to Bulk Operations from there isn't as easy navigating to it.

h3. Environment
* Windows 7
* Firefox latest
* NVDA Screen Reader

Note: MacOS VoiceOver do not have the issue, it has better navigation on page elements.

h3. Suggested Solution
Keyboard shortcut to Shared/Export/Tools option

h3. Why this is important
To have better user interaction for those rely on Accessibility
fields.summary: Accessibility: Issue Navigator - navigating to Bulk Operations

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Bulk Operations Step 3 is when a user choose which Custom field is to be updated. This page will load *all* the custom fields that are available for the projects chosen in the Bulk process. Enterprise clients may have a large number of custom fields that is applicable for a single project.

Listing all (assume 500 custom fields) in a single page is not scalable in performance and User friendliness, especially for meeting accessibility. Furthermore, the "Next" button is all the way to the bottom of the page.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the custom field to be in a list and selectable to add. Once selected, the custom field options or text will appear for user input. 

h3. Why this is important
* Helps to create a better interactive UI with normal users and users with needs
* Helps page performance at scale

h3. Workaround
* Use CTRL+F to find the particular field to make an update.
* User CTRL+F to find the "Unavailable Actions" to quickly jump near to "Next" button
fields.summary: Accessibility: Bulk Operations Step 3 - Choosing custom fields

fields.description:
To quote the extremely upset person (to the point of complaining publicly) person who reported this:
{quote}Who decided that the default avatar selection should include a full 5 white guys with facial hair, while only four that could maybe be read as intended to be female, and only 2 of darker skin tones? I guess I will be an owl.
{quote}
 

While Gravatar support is nice, some admins turn it off and so the default shipped user icon list should be significantly more diverse (both more women and a wider variety of skin tones).

!https://scontent.fsnc1-3.fna.fbcdn.net/v/t31.0-0/p403x403/19221602_10203446544759836_7605061313449401374_o.jpg?oh=e5922117e4cacc4e92dd6adb78c9e9e1&oe=59CABA0B!
fields.summary: Avatar list lacks diversity.

fields.description:
When Filter results is used in dashboard there's an option to show Sub-tasks column:

!jira1.PNG!

 

In the results those subtasks are referrred/displayed by a "key" (marked yellow below). It would be nice to also show the icon of the sub-task next to the key.

!jira2.PNG!

We're using 3 types of sub-tasks with distinctive icons and it would help to quickly understand what types of sub-tasks are there for the issue if the icon is visible.

I understand that maybe for majority of users the icon will be the same and not very helpful therefore it can be toggleable.
fields.summary: Show sub-tasks icon in sub-tasks field in Dashboard on Filter results

fields.description:
If different words/phrases have formatting added in the "Visual" editor, such as bold, underline, or links, the editor will move each formatted word after the first to a new line when the comment is saved. You can see this when the editor is switched to "Text" while editing.

!2017-6-3-15-45-37-541 (1).png|thumbnail!

!2017-6-3-15-46-21-328 (1).png|thumbnail!

!2017-6-3-15-46-41-798.png|thumbnail!

*Workaround:*

Use the text mode instead.
fields.summary: Rich Text Editor causes text to jump to next line when text formatting is used

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using a JQL that returns more than 1000 issues, attempting to navigate to pages until it displays 1001+ (usually page 21 and above) will result in the issue navigator freezing.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure that the JIRA instance has more than 1000 issues.
# Go to the issue navigator and run a JQL that returns more than 1000 issues.
# Navigate the pages until it will display issues *1001-xxxx of xxxx* where xxxx is the total number of issues in the projects. This is usually on page 21 or above by default.

h3. Expected Results
The Issue navigator will return issues 1001 and so on in the page.

h3. Actual Results
The issue navigator will be stuck loading but nothing will load at all. 
The rest of the JIRA UI will still be responsive. 

h3. Notes
Based on the KB: [How to increase the JIRA search results limit on the issue navigator|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-increase-the-jira-search-results-limit-on-the-issue-navigator-357696242.html?_ga=2.50945505.991592081.1497249977-589427334.1480340499], JIRA is supposed to show a message prompt to refine the search but based on testings with vanilla JIRA 7 instances, the message prompts do not appear and the user can proceed to click on pages for issues 1001+.
fields.summary: When attempting to access more than 1000+ results in List view, the issue navigator will be frozen

fields.description:
Currently there is no option on uninstalling plugin for associated active object tables/data to be removed.
There should be an option to ask customer - 
Do you want to remove all data associated with plugin or keep

This allows for xml backup and restore to run smoother if customers had already uninstalled the plugins. 
Sometimes customers will have issues on import due to plugins that were uninstalled and stops the import process and requires customers to manipulate their active objects and entities xml.
fields.summary: Ability to uninstall plugins with option to delete/drop database tables

fields.description:
This is functionality that would greatly improve the bulk edit capabilities and to extend the request even further it would be perfect if I could concatenate information together from more than one text field.

For example we have some residual information in a Risks field on 150+ records that we need to add to a Justifications field but we don't want to replace what is currently in the Justifications field. What we would like to do is concatenate(original_Justification+" Risks: "+original_Risks)

This is not the first time I have had to manually go through and update hundreds of records and although I know a script could be written to do this our developer's time is a hot commodity and not easily acquired for one off situations.
fields.summary: Add capability to bulk edit to allow pre-pending or appending text to text fields.

fields.description: when using multiple Field Configurations, and Viewing a Field Configuration instance, it would be nice if there was a Filter available to show/hide hidden fields, allowing a comprehensive view of the fields which were visible without viewing all the noise of hidden fields..
fields.summary: "View Field Configuration" Hide filter

fields.description: We're using issue updated event to do internal stuff based on which fields are changed. But there is an issue when multiple customfields may have the same name. It would be nice to have field id in ChangeItemBean for 3rd party addons (no need to store it in database, just for event listeners).
fields.summary: ChangeItemBean should have customfield id

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The {{maxResults}} parameter of GET {{/rest/api/2/issue/\{issueIdOrKey}/comment}} has no effect. It does not respect the default value 50 as per specified in the documentation.  

Link to documentation: https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/7.3.7/#api/2/issue-getComments

!737restapi.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue with 100 comments
# Run GET {{/rest/api/2/issue/\{issueIdOrKey}/comment}}
# Note the 'total' comments returned

h3. Expected Results
50 comments shown from the GET request

h3. Actual Results
GET request returns all comments (in this case 100 comments)
fields.summary: Default 'maxResults' parameter has no effect
REST API to GET default issue type of a Project

fields.description:
*Problem.*

Running simultaneously project re-index could be resource intensive and has a negative impact on performance. In large Enterprise environment (with multiple system administrators spread in multiple geos) it is near to impossible to prevent admins run simultaneous project index. 

*Suggestion.* 

Ideally, JIRA should provide monitoring for long-running (or resource intensive) tasks for the administrator group. Alternatively, admin should be prompted to acknowledge "project re-indexing already running on project A" before starting new project re-index.
fields.summary: Prevent simultaneous project re-index

fields.description:
As a user, I would like to type the JQL query directly into the gadget, instead of using an existing saved filter. 

This would allow users to easily modify the filter for that particular gadget, instead of having to modify the saved filter (which may be used by other gadgets) or create a new filter each time.
fields.summary: Allow direct JQL input into JIRA gadgets

fields.description:
h5. Problem
When using the CSV importer to import 21+ comments in a single ticket, it will not properly import all comments. Instead, only 20 comments are added and then repeat again. Comments above 20 are not added. This behaviour only occurs when:
* Created field is also populated with the CSV
* And no timestamps are provided for comments

h5. Steps to Reproduce
* Create a CSV file with over 20 comments or use this file: [^multiple_comment_import.csv]
** In this file, there are 25 comments, numbered 1 to 25
* In JIRA navigate to: *JIRA Admin > System > External System Import > CSV*
* Go through the import wizard:
** Select an existing project
** Ensure to map Comments, Created Date, Summary
* Once import is complete check the new tickets

h5. Expected Behaviour
All comments are properly imported from 1 to 25.

h5. Actual Behaviour
Only 20 of the 25 comments are imported and then 5 of those comments are repeated again. The comments seem to be random:
!imported-comments.png|thumbnail!
* In this case, notice that comments 1 to 5 are missing and 21 to 25 are duplicated.

h5. Notes
Just wanted to re-iterate that this only occurs when these conditions are met:
* Created field is also populated with the CSV
* And no timestamps are provided for comments
fields.summary: CSV Importer is Imporly Handling Large Number of Comments

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Users disabled in FreeIPA is not deactivated in JIRA. It seems JIRA isn't able to detect the flag which FreeIPA uses for disabled users.

h3. Suggestion
Allow JIRA to detect this so users disabled in FreeIPA will be deactivated in JIRA.

Based on [this comment|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CWD-2762?focusedCommentId=574930&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-574930], FreeIPA uses the nsAccoutnLock attribute
fields.summary: Jira should read from FreeIPA a flag to make users inactive

When creating an user, the page no longer displays the total user count nor does it display the user license count. See Screenshots:

JIRA 6.4

JIRA 7.0+
 !CreateUser-70.png|thumbnail!

This is an important feature that helped provide at a glance details on the current user license count.

Ensure that every change to an Atlassian product are beeing shiped at the same time for both Server and Cloud.

We got promissed on the Atlassian conference in Barcelona, that we would see that fetures in the future, could to out to the server before or at the same time as to the cloud.

But again there have been an importen upgrade on Portfolio on the Cloud, but not on the server, as an example.

As mentioned in this blog article: [JIRA admins: 5 new business templates that make onboarding easier|https://www.atlassian.com/blog/jira-core/jira-admins-5-new-business-templates-to-make-onboarding-easier], JIRA Core Cloud has introduced 5 new business project templates:

It would be nice if these business project templates are introduced to JIRA Core Server as well.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Using an issue link with a trailing slash causes a redirect to /browse

various trailing slashes are added to the URL format when using the new [Visual editing | https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver072/visual-editing-838542506.html] functions in conjunction with other wiki-markup switching between text and visual mode

h3. Steps to Reproduce
{code}
navigate to:
- http://<base_URL>/browse/issue_key/
- http://<base_URL>/browse/issue_key\
- http://<base_URL>/browse/issue_key//
- http://<base_URL>/browse/issue_key\\
{code}

h3. Expected Results
URL redirects to the Correct issue URL {{http://<base_URL>/browse/issue_key}}


h3. Actual Results
# The issue is redirected to {{http://<base_URL>/browse/}}
 !Screen Shot 2017-06-13 at 10.19.40 AM.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
# Any update applied from this location will trigger an error But the action completes successfully (exe: assign issue):
{code}
This issue can't be displayed right now
It could be for a variety of reasons, like a network or application error.
Try reloading the page.
{code}
 !Screen Shot 2017-06-13 at 10.26.19 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Remove Trailing slash from Issue URL
if you have already landed on the {{http://<base_URL>/browse/}} url select the Issue-key from the breadcrums at the top of the issue to load the full URL:
!Screen Shot 2017-07-07 at 3.30.45 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Issue URL with trailing slash causes redirect

None.
fields.summary: JIRA license check doesn't skip activeUsersCountForLicense cache for Unlimited Users

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary

If a user creates an issue  of type *subtask* in a project and while creating the issue, if the assignee is set, JIRA would not notify the assignee if an issue security scheme is in place even if the user in question is a member of the security scheme in question.

h5. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a new JIRA Project.
# Create a group single select custom field.
# Add the group jira-administrators to the field setting this value as the default option.
# Create a new issue security scheme.
# Add a security level and set the security level as the default.
# Add the reporter role and the group we created earlier to the security level as seen below(without the current assignee role):
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
# Create a new subtask issue.
# Add a member of the jira-administrators role as the assignee of the issue.

(i) The current assignee is already in the notification scheme for issue created hence this should not cause the problem.

h5. Expected Behavior

JIRA would trigger a notification to the user set as the current assignee letting him know that he has an issue assigned to him.

h5. Actual Behavior

JIRA would not notify the user unless you add the current assignee role to the Issue Security Scheme's security level.
fields.summary: Notification and Issue Security Issue
Update Plug in

fields.summary: Increase default max database connections from 20 to more optimal value

fields.description:
Hello,

We currently have users asking to not be notified when they are the one who updates a ticket. After working with our IT and digging into your documentation ([https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/creating-a-notification-scheme-776636401.html)] we found there is no "Updater" Role.

 

It also appears there may not be a concept of exclusion. That is, even if the "Updater" role was created, logic doesn't exist to explicitly Exclude that user from that notification; logic only appears to include users. Is this true?

 

Is it possible to both add an "Updater" Role & to allow for users/roles be excluded from mail notifications they would otherwise receive?

 

Thanks,

ZH
fields.summary: Add "Updater" Role in JIRA Notification Scheme

Unable to search for characters in between specifical characters like "-". Eg:

Strings:

{code:java}
PCB-SMAT-0087

{code}

{code:java}
description ~ "PCB*0087"
{code}


h3. Environment

JIRA 6.4.7 & JIRA 7.3.6


h3. Expected Results

JIRA does not shows result of issues with the characters in between special characters.


h3. Actual Results

JIRA shows result of issues with the characters in between special characters.


h3.Workaround

None

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As per [Editing the workflow transition for issue creation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/editing-the-workflow-transition-for-issue-creation-225116656.html], it is possible for an admin to edit the Create Issue inbound transition. 

However one of the options available for the customer is to add a screen here but if a user proceed to create an issue, the screen configured for the transition would not appear.

Instead, the recommended and official way to configure the screen that appears when creating issue is via [Associating a screen with an issue operation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/associating-a-screen-with-an-issue-operation-802592588.html].

h3. Suggested Solution

Remove the option for the admin to add a screen to the Create Issue inbound transition.
fields.summary: JIRA should not allow screens to be added to the Create Issue inbound transition.

fields.description:
Hi,

In the JIRA 7 release you changed from User to ApplicationUser (https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/latest-updates/preparing-for-jira-7-0/jira-7-0-api-changes) due to the "user key" concept and probably other reasons as well, but you have missed to refactor an important part.

Service: com.atlassian.jira.bc.user.search.UserSearchService

I was surprised to see that you still using de old "User" class when filtering users in this user search API. This is a problem because we need to convert the ApplicationUser to a User object, but it's not always a one-to-one mapping here. Sometimes there a user has multiple mapping keys. 

Here is an exception that can be thrown.
{code}
Caused by: java.lang.IllegalStateException: User 'mathias.edblom@riada.se' has no unique key mapping.
	at com.atlassian.jira.user.ApplicationUsers.from(ApplicationUsers.java:46)
{code}
 
and this causing the filtering to fail completely. If you have any workaround for this, please let me know.

Also, why are you still using till Guava function (google) instead of Java Function? Please change this as well. 

For any developer using this API (which I guess is many) the old "User" class is a pain....

Thanks & Cheers //Mathias
fields.summary: Change UserSearchParams to handle ApplicationUser

fields.description:
As outlined in our [JavaDocs|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/7.3.6/com/atlassian/jira/user/util/UserManager.html#generateRandomPassword--], the random password generated upon the creation of a new user follows its own policy.

Even though the password complies with most best practices, customers might expect it to follow the Password Policy setup in JIRA.
fields.summary: Automatic password creation for new users should follow JIRA's password policy

fields.description:
JIRA has a built-in function to generate a random password for a new user in case one is not manually input by the Administrator, however, there is no mention of that function in [Create, edit, or remove a user|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/create-edit-or-remove-a-user-861253174.html].

We should have information about this process, including the password policy to be followed, which is  only outlined in our [JavaDocs|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/7.3.6/com/atlassian/jira/user/util/UserManager.html#generateRandomPassword--].
fields.summary: Update documentation on creating an user to include automatic password creation

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary

In all the issue lists where dates are displayed (Created, Due, ...), date is shown in dd.M.yy format by default. 
 In English it looks correct: "23.May.17"
 If we switch to Russian it is displayed as: "23.мая.17" which should be "23.май.17".

"23.мая" means "23 of May" but "23.май" means just "23.May". The problem is that this format (using мая) is not accepted as an standard date by other applications (like excel or even JIRA Add-ons)
h5. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set language as Russian.
 # Go to any screen where a date column is displayed.

h5. Expected Behavior
 * Dates including May as a month are shown as "dd.*май*.yy"

h5. Actual Behavior
 * Dates are shown as "dd.*мая*.yy"

h5. Cause
 * Unknown.

h5. Workaround
 * When working with exports: after generating the exported file, manually replace "мая" with "май" to correct the date format.
 * There is no current workaround for add-ons or any other integration.
fields.summary: Incorrect russian translation of 'May' prevents it to be recognized as a date when exporting or interacting with add-ons

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary

JIRA [Project import page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/restoring-a-project-from-backup-802592982.html] mentions that Service Desk Customer portal cannot be imported, however in reality, there are no Service Desk related component imported nor is there any mention of any bugs relating to project import for JIRA Service Desk listed.

 !image-2017-06-12-18-10-00-410.png|thumbnail! 

h5. Feature Request

Can the project import documentation clearly state what can be imported and what would not be imported for JIRA Service Desk when a user is performing a project import for a Service Desk project?

Adding to the above, can a list of known verified bugs relating to Project Import and Service Desk be added to the page so that customers are aware of things to look out for?

This would help avoid confusion.

h5. Identify Known Bugs

To identify known bugs with the project import process for JIRA service desk, please consider doing the following:
# Go to https://jira.atlassian.com
# Go to the search issue page.
# Enter the following query to find a list of bugs that have been reported with regards project import
{code}
text ~ "project import"  and project = "JIRA Server (including JIRA Core)" and issuetype = Bug and status not in (Resolved,Closed)
{code}
#- You may want to remove the _status_ section if you are looking to perform the project import on a version different from the latest because the fixed bugs would be automatically marked as resolved or closed.

Below are some known bugs reported:

* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61427
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61182
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63226
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38858
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61569
fields.summary: Project Import Documentation

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary

When a user uses JIRA with McAfee VirusScan, at times, they still experience major performance degradation if the Antivirus is enabled even after following our guide [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/anti-virus-in-jira-applications-398393384.html].

h5. Feature Request

Can a section be added to this document for users who use McAfee VirusScan so they are aware that there is a need to still set the following processes _tomcat8.exe.x64_ and _mysqld.exe_ as low security level because this is the only condition where the changes made to the page would work properly as stated by our customer here:
{quote}
of course. We are using McAfee VirusScan and we had to define the processes “mysqld.exe” and “tomcat8.exe.x64” as low security processes. This then applied the defined folder exclusions for the folders specified in your guide correctly.

When the processes were not specifically defined as such low security processes but instead treated as standard processes, the exclusions for all standard processes did not seem to work. McAfee did not acknowledge this behavior, however we are able to reproduce it by changing the process category.
{quote}
fields.summary: Update To Using JIRA with AntiVirus Documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*.
{panel}
h4. +Scenario+

In JIRA 4.1.2, the attachment section shows the name of who attached the file:

!jira_4.1.2.png|thumbnail!

In JIRA 7, the name of who attached the file is not displayed, making the customer to go to management attachment screen or hover the mouse in alll files link to see the information:
h4. !jira_7.png|thumbnail!
h4. +Suggestion+

Include in attachment section in JIRA 7 the name of who attached the file like the layout was in JIRA 4.1.2
h4. +Notes+
 # There's no new settings from JIRA Administration -> System -> Attachments to take control of the layout
 # This detail information was dropped in JIRA 4.2, so all version before 4.1.2 doesn't have the information.
fields.summary: Attachment section in JIRA 7 does not show information about who attached the file

fields.description:
h5. Problem
The Pie Chart gadget results in a 500 error when the following conditions are met:
* JIRA Pie Chart Gadget
* Pie Chart users a Filter that references a different filter
* The JQL also contains the "WAS" operator
** All 3 of the above requirements must be met to reproduce the bug.


h5. Steps to Reproduce
* Create a filter referencing another filter and the WAS operator
** Example:
{code}
filter = "testfilter" and assignee was "admin"
{code}
* Save filter
* Navigate to the dashboard and add a Pie Chart gadget
* Use the filter we just created and save

h5. Expected Results
No problems, pie chart will load just fine.

h5. Actual Result
A 500 error showing something like this:
{code}
Looks like we can't show you the content of this gadget due to its configuration.
filterId should not be null!
500
com.atlassian.jira.util.dbc.Assertions$NullArgumentException: filterId should not be null!
{code}

h5. Other notes
The problem is specific to the Pie Chart Gadget
* Other gadgets work just fine with the filter
* Using the Pie Chart report via Projects
fields.summary: Pie Chart Gadget Cannot Parse JQL with Nested Filter and WAS operator
